techmeme.title: An investigation details how online gambling giants Flutter and Entain employ practices in the US that they dropped in the UK after admitting risks to UK users (Tom Bergin/Reuters)
OpenText to lay off 1,200 employees and add 800 positions, resulting in a ~1.7% reduction in workforce, and expects to reduce annual expenses by CA$150M in 2025 (CRN)
Canada authorizes the implementation of a 3% levy on revenue from large tech companies that provide digital services to or sell data of Canadian users (Paul Vieira/Wall Street Journal)
Ericsson expects a $1.1B noncash impairment charge in Q2 for its 2022 purchase of cloud communications company Vonage, after a $2.9B impairment charge in 2023 (Sabela Ojea/Wall Street Journal)
Microsoft agrees to pay $14.4M to settle with the California Civil Rights Department over allegations it discriminated against workers who took protected leave (Associated Press)
